javaslang.algebra

Interface Functor2<T1,T2>

  • Type Parameters:
    T1 - 1st component type of this monad
    T2 - 2nd component type of this monad
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Monad2<T1,T2,M>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Tuple2

    public interface Functor2<T1,T2>

    Defines a 2-ary Functor by generalizing the map function which maps two elements.

    All instances of the Functor2 interface should obey the two functor laws:
    • m.map(a -> a) ≡ m
    • m.map(f.compose(g)) ≡ m.map(g).map(f)
    where f, g ∈ Tuple2 → Tuple2.
    Since:
    1.1.0
    See Also:
    The functor design pattern

      Applies a separate function to each component of this Functor.

      • map

        Applies a function f to the components of this Functor.
        Type Parameters:
        U1 - type of the 1st component of the resulting Functor
        U2 - type of the 2nd component of the resulting Functor
        Parameters:
        f - a 2-ary Function which maps the components of this Functor

      • map

        Applies a separate function to each component of this Functor.
        Type Parameters:
        U1 - type of the 1st component of the resulting Functor
        U2 - type of the 2nd component of the resulting Functor
        Parameters:
        f1 - the Function applied to the 1st component of this Functor

        Returns:
